vague_description: Determining the optimal number of reactions to maximize output given limited resources.
detailed_description: There are two chemical reactions, chemical reaction A and chemical reaction B. Chemical reaction A requires \param{InertGasA} units of rare inert gas and \param{WaterA} units of treated water to produce \param{CompoundA} units of a rare compound. Chemical reaction B requires \param{InertGasB} units of rare inert gas and \param{WaterB} units of treater water to produce \param{CompoundB} units of a rare compound. There are \param{TotalInertGas} units of the rare inert gas and \param{TotalWater} units of treated water available in the lab. How many reactions of each type should be done to maximize the amount of rare compound produced?
target_objective: Maximize the amount of rare compound produced from both reactions
target_constraints: Number of chemical reaction A is non-negative
Number of chemical reaction B is non-negative
Total use of inert gas by reaction A and B does not exceed TotalInertGas units
Total use of treated water by reaction A and B does not exceed TotalWater units
target_parameters: Amount of rare inert gas required for chemical reaction A
Amount of treated water required for chemical reaction A
Amount of the rare compound produced by chemical reaction A
Amount of rare inert gas required for chemical reaction B
Amount of treated water required for chemical reaction B
Amount of the rare compound produced by chemical reaction B
Total amount of rare inert gas available
Total amount of treated water available
